citation.article-title: Corynebacterium doosanense sp. nov., isolated from activated sludge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Corynebacterium doosanense sp. nov.

Corynebacterium doosanense (doo.san.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. doosanense belonging to Doosan, named after the Doosan group, the Foundation of Chung-Ang University where the taxonomic studies on this species were performed).
Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore-forming, irregular and club-shaped rods, 0.8–1.0×1.0–1.2 μm in size.
Colonies (1–2 mm in diameter) are yellow and low-convex on GYEA media and yellow, opaque and low-convex on sheep blood agar after 48 h incubation at 30 °C.

Catalase, oxidase, reduction of nitrate and hydrolysis of hippuric acid are positive and activities are detected for sodium pyruvate, pyrazinamidase, esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.

No activity is detected for pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, leucine aminopeptidase, urease or hydrolysis of gelatin and aesculin.
Acid production occurs only from glucose.
Whole-cell hydrolysates contain mainly galactose and arabinose.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 53.5 mol%.
The type strain is CAU 212T (=KCTC 19568T=CCUG 57284T), isolated from activated sludge taken from a wastewater treatment plant in Yeongdeuk-gun, Republic of Korea.
